content: 13 silver and last but not least the scalloped border you can use all your small leftovers for this border using any colour attach yarn to any corner space 1 double_crochet in same space 7 treble_crochet in next space 1dc in next space 7 treble_crochet in next space 1 double_crochet in next space 7 treble_crochet in next space 1 double_crochet in next space and finish off choose another colour and attach to same space 1dc in same space 7 treble_crochet in next space and continue changing colour after every three scallops until you get to the corner a little bit of fudging is required here as the scallops do not quite work out perfectly along the edge so fit as many as you can up till the corner then work 5 double_crochet into the corner and continue with the scallops if you get two scallops of let s say old gold fitted in before the corner make one more in that colour after the corner and then continue in three s it is possible to carry the end of the last colour along the back and underneath the next scallops to work it in but i prefer to sew them in nice and snugly giving the last double_crochet a nice tug to tighten the scallop and neaten it and that s it folks a little wash as noted at the start and your blanket is finished i hope you enjoyed making it as much as i did
